data.title: 3000 Years of Fantasy & Science Fiction – L. Sprague De Camp (1972) (1st ed) – GOHD Books
data.text:
Contents:

Foreword by Isaac Asimov

Introduction

Homer – The Odyssey (excerpt)

Plato – Timaios (excerpt)

Cyrano de Bergerac – A Journey to the Moon (abridged)

H. G. Wells – The New Accelerator

H. P. Lovecraft – The Cats of Ulthar

Stanley G. Weinbaum – A Martian Odyssey

Lester del Rey – Helen O’Loy

Tom Godwin – The Cold Equations

L. Sprague de Camp – A Gun for Dinosaur

Arthur C. Clarke – Before Eden

Isaac Asimov – The Last Question

Milestones – Novels Worth Reading

About the editor (from Wikipedia):

Lyon Sprague de Camp (27 November 1907 – 6 November 2000), better known as L. Sprague de Camp, was an American writer of science fiction, fantasy and non-fiction. In a career spanning 60 years, he wrote over 100 books, including novels and works of non-fiction, such as biographies of other fantasy authors. He was a major figure in science fiction in the 1930s and 1940s.
